meanings.sent1: The ancient building had a beautiful columella at its entrance.
meanings.sent2: The garden was decorated with small columellas supporting the archway.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ants marched around the columella, pretending it was their castle.
meanings.sent4: Her words stood tall like a columella, supporting her argument.
meanings.sent5: The columella stood strong, like a miniature tower in the room.

meanings.definition: The central axis or central part of a structure
meanings.sent1: The columella of the bridge held the weight of the entire structure.
meanings.sent2: The columella of the clock tower was visible from afar.
meanings.sent3: The party guests gathered around the columella of the room, the center of attention.
meanings.sent4: His voice acted as the columella of the choir, guiding the harmony.
meanings.sent5: The columella of the tree trunk was the strongest, supporting all branches.

meanings.definition: A fleshy structure that connects the two halves of a mushroom cap
meanings.sent1: The chef carefully removed the columella from the mushroom before cooking.
meanings.sent2: The columella of the mushroom was soft and delicate.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the columella as a tightrope to cross the forest path.
meanings.sent4: The columella of the mushroom cap was like a bridge between two worlds.
meanings.sent5: The columella of the mushroom held the cap together, like a natural glue.
